channel.title: English on Rebell
channel.description: Recent content in English on Rebell

item.title: Old PokÃ©mon Snap
item.description: A week or two ago I started playing a game I’ve been thinking about playing ever since the sequel was announced, over 20 years after the first game. PokÃ©mon Snap. Admittedly I first thought about buying the new game, ‘New PokÃ©mon Snap’. But it felt a bit expensive for a rail shooter in 2021, especially since its coming from a game company that doesn’t really care. So I thought I’d wait for a while, see if the price dropped. Not very long after however, Nintendo announced that the original PokÃ©mon Snap would come to Nintendo Online. So my plan changed, and I was to try the original first, and if I liked it, I would consider buying the new one.

item.title: Tony Hawk'sâ„¢ Pro Skaterâ„¢ 1 + 2
item.description: A while ago I beat THPS 1+2 for the fifth time and it’s still as good of a game as the first time. I never played the originals when they released, but I did play a lot of Tony Hawk as a kid. THPS 3 was the first in the series I played, a cousin lent it to me after I had gotten hold of a used PlayStation 2. It was a great game, but I had heard that there were better Tony Hawk games. Underground 1 and 2, where it was possible to throw tomatoes, ride a bull and spray your own tag across the city. But most importantly, you didn’t need to ride ALL the time. If you wanted to aim for a specific jump or go for a certain rail, it was possible to get off the board and walk there. Eventually I got to play these games as well, at friends places and sometimes I even got to borrow them for short periods of time, but my first ever own Tony Hawk’s, was American Wasteland.

item.title: The White Avicii Nintendo Switch Lite
item.description:
Nintendo has done a lot of custom coloured Switches, especially of the standard Switch. The ’lite’ version though, mostly has some basic recolours. And a couple of PokÃ©mon variants. But there is one Switch Lite that stands out of the crew. The white, custom gold painted Avicii Invector Switch Lite.

2017 Hello There Games released ‘Invector’ on the PS4. A rhythm based music game with 22 of Aviciis hit songs. In 2019, the year after his tragic passing, they released an updated version with 35 songs, in collaboration with the Tim Bergling Foundation. Avicii Invector: Encore Edition, and with the release, there was a charity auction, where all the money gathered went to the mental health organisation, Safe In Our World. This is where the rare Switch Lite enters the stage. Five beautiful custom painted switches were auctioned out. And what makes them extra special is that they’re actually licensed by Nintendo. Many companies has had lotteries or the like with custom painted or shells swapped switches, but this is actually a fully legit licensed Nintendo Switch Lite, and it. Is. Beautiful!

item.title: The 1 of 1 Ring
item.description: A couple days ago Wizards of the Coast revealed some cards for the new Lord of the Rings crossover set. One of which was “The One Ring”. “The One Ring”, is going to have a specialÂ specialÂ edition - extended art with text in elvish (Quenya in Tengwar letterform to be exact, if that tells you anything you’re a huge NERD). This card, among some others, will be what they call serialized. Numbered card, that show exactly which card you got, from a limited print run.

item.title: Co - Star
item.description:
Today I learned about Co-Star, and therefore, so will you!
It’s an astrology app, and just like many others like it, it gives the user a daily horoscope. But this one is special, because this one is “based on science”. It uses data fromÂ NASA JPLÂ and the “magic of dates and AI”, to find patterns and create horoscopes. Created by Banu Guler, a woman who, ackording to Wikipedia, once brought an astrological chart to a baby shower, where she noticed it was such a hit, she decided to create an app for it. ðŸ¤·. Wild stuff. She does however have a killerÂ website, so go check that one out!

item.title: MAR10
item.description: March 10, a.k.a. MAR10 day. First celebrated by Nintendo 2016, probably when some clever Nintendian came up with the idea. And since then, theyâ€™ve actually made something each year to celebrate Mario, even if some years have been lazier than others. This year we got the final trailer for The Super Mario Bros. Movie, Wave 4 of the Mario Kart 8 Deluxe â€“ Booster Course Pass (car stuff, pretty fitting since itâ€™s also the V8 engines day today) and a new Mario themed Nintendo Switch bundle. And lots of smaller stuff as well. Like whatever this is. I must admit though, I am pretty hyped for the movie, so another trailer is always welcome!

item.title: Games man
item.description: Iâ€™ve been playing a lot of games lately. Orâ€¦ A lot of games for the very limited amount of spare time I have at hands. Itâ€™s been loads for fun though. More fun than I have had gaming in a long long time. I quite recently bought a new graphics card, and I guess I have to attribute my newfound joy to this, as Iâ€™ve not been able to enjoy AAA titles to their extent in recent years. Donâ€™t get me wrong, many smaller game studios make incredible games as well, but itâ€™s something special to get a full experience of a game that was made of hundreds of people over several years. At least if itâ€™s done well. And let me tell you about a game that does it REALLY well! Forza Horizon 5 Holy hell is it a well made game. Big open world. Lots of stuff to unlock. Many corners to dig deep into.

item.title: Hell!-oh and welcome to my website!
item.description:
This is my very own little nook on the internet, where I try out new things, show off what I like and generally just do whatever I want.

Right now itâ€™s a bit under construction, and in a way I think it always will be. Hopyfully this page will always keep growing with new side projects popping up here and there.ðŸ¤ž 🙈
